Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: scorp2
Reviews.Content: - You can "actually" listen to people snoring in the other room.. no chance of you getting any sleep. - You can also listen to their TV, no need of turning on your own, which by the way is a pathetic 10 year old CRT based TV with grainy picture quality. - when you walk on the floor, you can feel and listen to it, sqeaking - The ambience of the rooms is like "old" and "refurbished".. very dull atmosphere - It charges you about 5+ USD to do a run of laundry, which is not great anyway...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the Westfield shopping mall,it is clean,affordable, wifi and near the airport. Ana has great customer service skills and very pleasant. I would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: Minniegrumby
Reviews.Content: Worst experience ever. Rooms smell.beds are horrible/uncomfortable n very squecky. My husband complaint all night about uncomfortable. BAthrooms were disgusting. I don't think they even clean them. N their cleaning cart goes down the hall at 6am with a loud tire squeaky noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean, Cheap”
Reviews.Author: ns3dolphin
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff was always very nice. Cheap hotel that is not far from beaches.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP”
Reviews.Author: MrMagillicuty
Reviews.Content: I would have rather slept in my car (if I had one). We were flown into LAX and booked into this place by a TV show we were on. They didn't book us into their regular hotel as it was last minute and it was sold out. This place was scarey! There was seldome anyone manning the front desk. People waited 30 minutes to get checked in. The staff was rude. The room dirty. Bathtub had not been cleaned and the shower head broken. Linens were stained, worn out and had long hair in all of them! (we both have very short hair). You have to take your own garbage out to the dumpster! Other guests on the tv show had the same complaints. Also, this is a big one.... they have posted in their rooms that maid service is only offered after you have stayed 6 nights! Otherwise you pay for the service. The service does not include doing the dishes we had to wash prior to our leaving so as not to get charged. We would have been better off staying in a jail! This was the most disgusting place I have ever stayed. I have traveled all over and have never seen anything this bad. I'm sorry I can't provide pictures to you. It was so bad I didn't unpack my bags.

Reviews.Title: “Good play to stay for long stays”
Reviews.Author: Karthiv
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd visit to this hotel, and extremely happy about this. offers decent suit, good kitchen-ate, nice locality surrounded by malls, and close to my work. Lot of dining options near by (Howard hughes center, Fox Hill mall...). Nice and warm staff.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: asabidavis
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for one week while in LA for my church convocation.. Room was clean, service was good.. Had an Iron that would not get hot and got another one that was a better grade. Just wish rooms had more pots for cooking. Otherwishe for the price it was just fine for me.. Will use this place next year when i return. Asabi Davis

Reviews.Title: “Really Really crappy room”
Reviews.Author: aaa201076
Reviews.Content: We came here after our lovely stay in staybridge suites and felt like we moved in to a cheapest motel room. The lighting in the room was terrible. Out of the 5 lights 3 were white and 2 were yellow. We picked this hotel due to the kitchen. The utensils were unclean, the sink used to clog and took a while to drain. No Dishwasher. The beds were really bad. very squeaky. After we pulled the covers for some reason the box spring and mattress looked like they were picked up from garbage and had stains all over. The last mattress I threw away was about 100 times better than this one. The carpet looked very old and unclean. Best thing was that, I told my wife that this place needs renovation and when we went out we say a large sign on the hotel wall that says "All rooms are renovated". TV was old, Drawer was old and looked like it came from a garage sale. water in the bathroom sink was stinky. Only Best thing about this place I think is its very close to the LAX airport. 7 mins flat. I wouldn't recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Studio with Kitchen Facility”
Reviews.Author: myreviewfromla
Reviews.Content: This place is very close to LAX probably about 10 minutes from the airport. Neat and clean Studio rooms with Kitchen. Close to Howard Hughes Promenade where there are lot of options to eat and this is right next to Dinah's. Albertsons and CVS is also at walkable distance. The reception and staff was very helpful in providing help as needed. This was my first time in the US and I did not feel uncomfortable at all. Note that I stayed here in 2005. This was not an option in the year srop down. Never the less the standard of the hotel remains the same.

Reviews.Title: “Near the airport, and good for budget-friendly travelers”
Reviews.Author: dimplex99
Reviews.Content: The location was very convenient, right off the interstate. There’s a large mall within walking distance, and a small shopping center next door. We chose this location for the price and the convenience near the airport. I thought the girl at the check-in desk was fairly rude, because she didn’t even look at me when I tried to check-in, but rather just told me to have a seat my room isn’t ready yet. The room had a kitchen, microwave, and stove. I would rate the rooms clean for a budget-hotel. There were two things that annoyed me about the room. # 1 The toilet keeps running every 30 minutes, which got rather annoying in the middle of the night. # 2 The A/C unit is rather old and was very noisy. We Picelined this hotel for $70/night and am pleased with the overall experience, but wouldn’t spend more than $90/night here. I’ve stayed at much better Extended-Stay locations in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves more credit than some reviews give it”
Reviews.Author: lil_star04
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotwire and got a great price for it. For the price that we paid, it was a really good hotel. It was a spacious room with free parking. The hotel is in a great, safe location, not too far from the Howard Hughs Centre (which includes some nice places to eat and an imax theatre) and down the road from the Fox Hills Mall (Currently undergoing renovation for expansion). It is also not too long a drive from areas in LA. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and we stayed there with no problems for 9 nights. The room is clean and comfortable. A maid comes once a week to change towels and clean up. The refridgerator can be a little noisy at night but that was really my only complaint. The bullet-proof glass, as mentioned in some earlier reviews, really isn't that bad. Whilst i was staying there, the glass was always open, There was no intercom, and the receptionist talked to us face to face, therefore seemed to me like a normal reception area. The hotel is very close to the Airport but, i never saw/heard any planes. I would definately, for the price I paid, stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: payme1397
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel through Priceline and got a great deal on our two nights here. I probably wouldn't pay their advertised rate, but we got it for about half off. It is a great location! Right next to the 405 and Howard Hughes Shopping center where you can shop and eat. Very convenient location. Our only complaint was that there are no ammenities such as shampoo, maid service, breakfast ... but it was no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Another Bowden Review: Yikes, Read before staying here”
Reviews.Author: Bowden68
Reviews.Content: I drive up to this hotel and saw a lot of windows open as it was a nice day. Rarely do you see windows open in a hotel, but so be it. Problem is the place looks beat up, and with no other hotels nearby it looked liked low income housing. So I park, walk in, and I go to the front desk, and it's encased in bullet proof glass. The guy behind the glass speaks through an intercom so it feels like you are in some type of jail or something. Funny thing is the area is not really that bad. Wierd. I go to the room, and bottom line, it's a Super 8 with a kitchen. Furniture is beat up, and very cheap. The "desk" wobbles and the bed is rock hard with cheap sheets. The inside of the room is dark, dreary and very dated. My guess is the place is 10 years old and nothing has been updated since the opening. The kitchen, while I did not use it, looked servicable. I pricelined this hotel, and I bid on a two star hotel for $50. I will never bid two stars again if this is what 2 stars gets you. It's no frills, cheap looking and feeling, dark/dreary, and simply a place to lie your head. Luckily I only had to sleep there, so I did not have to spend that much time there. Despite the below reviews, I never felt "unsafe" in the hotel or the area. For some reason they put bullet proof glass in the lobby so that spooks people. If you are on a tight budget, well, it's ok I guess. I just don't like to stay in places like this.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your combat gear”
Reviews.Author: AriGold444
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was looking for a hotel for a month which at that time was hard to get in LA. So I trusted the name and took extended stay for granted. When I arrived at the property, I felt extremely uncomfortable as the parking lot was on the opposite side of the entrance of the building. The entrance itself looked more like a prison gate than a $200 a night hotel reception - double armored glass doors. And instead of a bell desk or a reception desk, again there was a safe room with bulletproof glass and a two-way intercom just as you´ll find in high-security settings. I felt in a prison or in the middle of a gang war, honestly. To pass your credit card to the receptionist involved placing it in one of the metal sliding drawers that can only be operated from one side of the bulletproof glass, and it aint yours ! I changed my mind about staying at this Extended Stay Hotel and left wondering who in his right mind would be brave enough to stay at that kind of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's ONLY ok because of the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: sulitster
Reviews.Content: I am not going to complain too much because of the price I paid to stay at this motel. I need to tell you though, that I would never ever stay at this hotel again. To think that they normally would charged over $100 a night is ridiculous, as this place is no better than the typical roadside motels on state highways of bygone years. The building is nice on the outside but as you walk in to the lobby things start to unravel. The most noticeable and scary part for me is that the front desk is behind a BULLET RESISTANT glass. That alone should tell you that something is wrong, when management thinks it's not enough to have security guards on post in the lobby and patrolling outside, but to also protect their employees like some political figure. The elevators are dirty with stains on the floor and scartch marks along the wall. The carpet along the corridor and inside my room is very dirty. My room is simple which is fine but I think that they have to periodically try to update it as I think it hasn't been renovated since it first opened. The flourescent lighting in the room do not match, some of them produce yellow hues and some bright white. The bed is too soft and they only provide for two pillows. Internet connection is $4.99 but it wasn't good, it was worst than dial-up. Tried calling technical help line but said that the problem is with the ISP company that the hotel does business with. I ended up using the signal coming from a restaurant next door. I am not a picky person, it's just that if a hotel wants to charged something what a 3-star hotel would charge, it should be able to provide descent service, and certainly this hotel failed to do that. So bottom line, I would not recommend this place to anyone for any reason. You are probably better off sleeping in your car or a bus bench.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: My wife is a travel agent, but she uses Priceline on occasion when traveling on her own dime. We ended up at this airport area hotel when looking for reasonable cost for five nights in LA, and we were both pleasantlly surprised by the ESA LAX. For one, the room was clean and comfortable. The "kitchen" area lacks an oven, so our frozen pizza was a waste, but it does have a cooktop, a microwave and a fridge. (LIke all rooms with a refrigerator, the thing makes a bit of noise at night which can disturb a light sleeper. Easy to unplug!). The hotel staff sits behind bulletproof glass in their registration area, which scared us at first and which reminds you that you are in an ultra-budget category. But, they are friendly and helpful. The property appears to be about ten years old, everything was working in the room except for the Internet access, which was a giant pain and required an hour or two of technical service, and it never did get going. They don't know anything at the front desk about the internet, so you have to call a toll free number. I got to know the tech rep in Poland by his first name before I left. Luckily, there is a great diner (Dinah's) right next door with blazing fast internet for free. The location is fantastic. Just a short walk to The Bridge, which has Cinema and about a dozen eating places, ranging from nice Mexican and fast food places to some really good stuff at Callendar's Grille. Safe area -- we didn't see a plane or any evidence of being near the airport. Definitelly worth a try if you are looking for a decent, clean but cheap place in the LA area. My rating of four out of five on this property does not mean this is a 4 star hotel, but simply that for the money, we were pleasantly surprised.
